title: Kevin Bennett
text: Kevin "Bulldog" Bennett (born 15 August 1975, in <a href="Birmingham">Birmingham</a>) is an <a href="English%20people">English</a> <a href="professional">professional</a> <a href="lightweight">light</a>/<a href="light%20welterweight">light welter</a>/<a href="welterweight">welter</a>/<a href="light%20middleweight">light middleweight</a> <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> of the 1990s and 2000s, who as an amateur won the 1999 <a href="Amateur%20Boxing%20Association%20of%20England">Amateur Boxing Association of England</a> light welterweight (64 kg) title, against Daniel Happe (Repton ABC), boxing out of Hartlepool Boys ABC, and as a professional won the <a href="List%20of%20Commonwealth%20Boxing%20Council%20Champions%23lightweight">Commonwealth lightweight title</a>, and was a challenger for the <a href="International%20Boxing%20Organization">International Boxing Organization</a> (IBO) lightweight title against <a href="Jason%20Cook%20%28boxer%29">Jason Cook</a>, and <a href="British%20Boxing%20Board%20of%20Control">British Boxing Board of Control</a> (BBBofC) lightweight title against <a href="Graham%20Earl">Graham Earl</a>, his professional fighting weight varied from , i.e. <a href="lightweight">lightweight</a> to , i.e. <a href="light%20middleweight">light middleweight</a>.
